Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Diazoxide Cardioprotection in Mouse Models of Global Ischemia

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomised controlled trial involved isolated mouse myocytes and hearts.

Intervention.evidence: Myocytes were exposed to Tyrode's solution, hyperkalemic cardioplegia (CPG) ± diazoxide, ± VU591 (Kir1.1 inhibitor), and Tyrode's solution again.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to clarify its mechanism of action in cardiac surgery settings.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Myocyte contractility was reduced by CPG but preserved by diazoxide.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Investigators were blinded to group assignments.

Result_Outcome.evidence: In hearts, diazoxide improved left ventricular function post-ischemia in all mouse types.
